messages.message: Hey everyone, I was iterating on the prompts for split-classify and deciding on the classification metrics to consider. I wanted to understand the classification score used on the platform today. I was wondering what this classification accuracy means for the case of split-classify: documents with multiple pages belonging to multiple classes?

So say a doc has 4 pages:
GT says: page 1-2 is Class A, 3-4 is class B
prediction says: page 1 is Class A, 2-4 is class B

In this case, what should be the classification accuracy?
Is it:
1 :white_check_mark: 2 :x:3 :white_check_mark:4 :white_check_mark: and so *75%*
or is it:
Class A: 1 :x:
Class B: 2-4 :x:
and so *0%?*
Basically, do we consider partially correct splits?
